nodes.bodyText: Question is if we should just ignore these wrong implementations in bindings or if we should throw an exception here and force the developer to fix it.

Being completely silent about it doesn't feel right. Would the exception be thrown every time the state options are accessed? If so, that could result in a lot of exceptions. Maybe just log it instead?
I added a ERROR log message.
Can you also update the JavaDocs of these providers for the fact that if the result is not null it should not be the original object?
Great! Also nice to see some unit tests for this. 👍
